sat_solver_backtracking

Class Formula

  • java.lang.Object
    • sat_solver_backtracking.Formula

  • public class Formula
extends java.lang.Object
    A formula is a conjunction (and) of clauses, or a single clause The formula evaluates itself and returns true if satisfiable and false otherwise Recursively travels up and down the formula to solve the formula using backtracking
    Version:
    03/30/2016
    Author:
    Adam Tucker, Dennis Kluader, Umair Chaudry

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Formula()
      This constructor takes no arguments

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addClause(Clause c)
      This method adds a clause to this formula
      Formula createChild(boolean givenBoolean)
      Creates a child formula to be tested by the solver As the solver recursively travels through the collection each new child will have a new formula evaluated by the create child method
      int getLastIndex()
      Gets the last index
      int getNumClauses()
      This method returns the number of clauses in the formula
      int getNumVariables()
      This method returns the number of variables in the formula

      Gets the success state
      boolean isEmpty()
      Empty of the formula has been solved

      This method loads and returns a formula from a file specification

      Recursive backtracking call to solve the formula

      Sets the last index
      void setNumVariables(int numVariables)
      This method sets the number of variables in the formula
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string as {{1 true or 2 true} and (3 false and 4 false}}

        public boolean runSolver()
        Recursive backtracking call to solve the formula

        True if the formula is satisfiable and false otherwise

      • createChild

        public Formula createChild(boolean givenBoolean)
        Creates a child formula to be tested by the solver As the solver recursively travels through the collection each new child will have a new formula evaluated by the create child method
        Parameters:
        givenBoolean - The value to evaluate with the current formula
        Returns:
        The new formula that has been evaluated at the current level with any satisfied clause removed and unnecessary literal removed

      • readFromFile

        public static Formula readFromFile(java.lang.String filename)

        Parameters:
        filename - Name of the file containing the formula
        Returns:
        The parsed Formula
